resourceManager

Class ResourceUser

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • resourceManager.ResourceUser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ResourceUser
extends java.lang.Thread
    A resource user may make use of any number of Resources, each of which is managed by a ResourceManager.

    A resource user may, through a resource's manager, request access, with a given prioroty, to the resource. If no other resource user is using the resource, access is granted. If, however, the resource is in use the resource's manager will ensure that the resource user must wait for access. When the resource ibecomes available (because some other resource user has released the resource) the resource manager will, if there are any resource users currently waiting to access the resource, determine what the highest priority is at which resource users are waiting and allow one of these highest priority users to access the resource.

    Resources only have a finite number of uses. Once a resource has been used this number of times it is exhausted, and may not be used any more. If all of a resource user's resources are exhausted the resource user will terminate.

    Version:
    February 2020
    Author:
    Hugh Osborne

    • Field Detail

      • managers

        private java.util.List<ResourceManager> managers
        The managers of the resources that this resource user wishes to use. A resource user will terminate once all resource managers have terminated (because their resources are no longer available. The resource managers need to be stored in a list rather than a set in order to allow random access.

      • random

        private java.util.Random random
        Used to determine the time for which this resource user requires a resource

      • maxTimeRequiredMillis

        private int maxTimeRequiredMillis
        The maximum length of time for which this resource user will require any resource.

      • priority

        private int priority
        The current priority at which the resource user is currently operating. The default value is the lowest priority - i.e. 0

    • Constructor Detail

      • ResourceUser

        public ResourceUser(java.lang.String name,
                    double maxTimeRequired,
                    java.util.Set<ResourceManager> managers)
        Set the name and maximum useage time, and initialise the resource managers.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of this resource user.
        maxTimeRequired - the maximum time, in seconds, for which this resource user will ever require any resource.
        managers - the managers of the resources this resource user is going to use.

    • Method Detail

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Check whether this resource user is still active. Every time a resource manager reports that its resource is no longer available that resource manager is removed from the resource manager list. A resource user becomes inactive when all of the resource managers' resources have become unavailable, and all of the resource managers have therefore been removed from the resource manager list.
        Returns:
        true iff there are one or more resource managers still in the resource manager list.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Construct a string containing this resource user's name and information about its current priority level.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Thread

      • run

        public void run()
        Run this resource user. The resource user will run until all of the resources are exhausted. In each cycle the resource user will:
        • Select an active resource (manager), if such exists.
        • Request a resource at a random priority level.
        • Wait, if necessary, for the resource to become available
        • Use the resource for a random length of time.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread
